name: Rape Crisis Hotline
description: The Rape Crisis Hotline is operated by Mountain Comprehensive Care Center's Healing Program, providing 24-hour crisis support for survivors of sexual assault, child abuse, and interpersonal violence. The program serves Floyd, Johnson, Magoffin, Martin, and Pike counties in Kentucky's Big Sandy Region. Services include crisis counseling, individual and group therapy, legal and medical advocacy, SANE (Sexual Assault Nurse Examiner) exams, and crisis shelter at The Healing Place. All services are confidential and free.
source: Verified from official Mountain Comprehensive Care Center website and Healing Program page
services: 24-hour crisis hotline, crisis counseling, individual counseling, group counseling, legal advocacy, medical advocacy, SANE exams, crisis shelter, peer support, community education, prevention training, transportation assistance
eligibility: Survivors of sexual assault, child abuse, or interpersonal violence in Floyd, Johnson, Magoffin, Martin, and Pike counties
notes: Part of Mountain Comprehensive Care Center. Serves the Big Sandy Region of Kentucky. The Healing Place crisis center provides temporary shelter (up to 15 days) for survivors. SANE exams available to avoid hospital emergency room visits. Bilingual services available (English/Spanish).
